education.research_topic: Empowering older adults to engage with their own health data using multimodal feedback
education.description: Exploring accessibility and usability challenges for older adults using sensor devices. Investigating new ways to convey physiological sensing data to engage them in improving their health.

education.degree: Master of Science Advanced Computer Science (Distinction)
education.research_project: Verifying user interfaces with Spark Ada, a case study for the T35 syringe pump
education.description: Collaborated on interactive systems research, performed comparative solutions analysis for hand therapy, and developed an embodied prototype for non-assisted therapy.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

publications.title: Accessibility of Health Data Representations for Older Adults: Challenges and Opportunities for Design
publications.authors: P Jean, E Murphy, E Bates

publications.title: What does THIS Mean?: A Collaborative Expert Evaluation of Health Data Representations for Older Adults
publications.authors: P Jean, E Murphy, E Bates
publications.conference: International Conference on Computers Helping People with Special Needs

certifications.description: Completed the Executive Education program for world-class leaders and nonprofit managers to tackle challenging social problems hosted by Thunderbird School of Global Management.

Web Design and Styling (CSS, Typography, Color Theory)
